dt: {bc}marked by an often ill-natured inclination to stress faults and raise objections
{bc}calculated to confuse, entrap, or entangle in argument

pt: {sc}critical{/sc} {sc}hypercritical{/sc} {sc}faultfinding{/sc} {sc}captious{/sc} {sc}carping{/sc} {sc}censorious{/sc} mean inclined to look for and point out faults and defects. {sc}critical{/sc} may also imply an effort to see a thing clearly and truly in order to judge it fairly.
{sc}hypercritical{/sc} suggests a tendency to judge by unreasonably strict standards.
{sc}faultfinding{/sc} implies a querulous or exacting temperament.
{sc}captious{/sc} suggests a readiness to detect trivial faults or raise objections on trivial grounds.
{sc}carping{/sc} implies an ill-natured or perverse picking of flaws.
{sc}censorious{/sc} implies a disposition to be severely critical and condemnatory.

et: Middle English {it}capcious{/it}, from Middle French or Latin; Middle French {it}captieux{/it}, from Latin {it}captiosus{/it}, from {it}captio{/it} deception, verbal quibble, from {it}capere{/it} to take {ma}{mat|heave:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: marked by an often ill-natured inclination to stress faults and raise objections
calculated to confuse, entrap, or entangle in argument
